intro: Bulbophyllum furciferum, commonly known as the forked bulbophyllum, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically has dark green, leathery leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Bulbophyllum furciferum is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
